intro: Opicrina, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pink star-shaped flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. Opicrina typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value has made it a popular garden plant, though care must be taken due to its toxic properties.
